results.purpose: Product development roadmap for Good Chop's 2025/2026 initiatives, tracking strategic projects, sprints, team capacity, and key deliverables across quarters
key_data_points: Dev capacity ranges from 5-33 story points across sprints
Legal deadlines: July 14 (Funnel, Cancellation deflection), August 18 (all changes published)
Migration to Pricing service needed: mid-October

entities.name: Wallet
entities.context: Major initiative with minor funnel work, error monitoring, campaigns launch, full launch with voucher migration

entities.name: Dashboard
entities.context: Separate new dashboard development (Milestone 1), paused after Milestone 1 for CRO initiatives

entities.name: Seamless
entities.context: Development on funnel, UAT phases, placeholder bugs

entities.name: Welcome Kit
entities.context: Items available May 29, development and UAT, marketing campaigns launched June 6

entities.name: Search
entities.context: Must keep allocating until INP resolved, launched June 23 with product cards

entities.name: One Time Purchase (OTP)
entities.context: MVP spike and development for funnel and post-checkout, order created for Dig-tracking

entities.name: RAF (Refer-a-Friend)
entities.context: Credit reward at $0, mentioned across Q1-Q2

entities.name: Wunderkind
entities.context: Fixed cookie sizes on July 24

entities.name: Genesys
entities.context: Widget live after HF CC widget removed July 16

entities.name: PCS v2
entities.context: Rolled out to 20% on July 23, 100% on July 31

insights: Heavy focus on CRO (Conversion Rate Optimization) initiatives in Q2-Q3, causing pause of new Dashboard development after Milestone 1
Multiple team capacity constraints due to overlapping leaves (maternity, paternity, OOO) particularly in Q3-Q4
Significant technical migrations planned: Voucher Migration, Pricing service migration, Cash Credits migration, PCS v2 migration
Legal compliance is a major driver with multiple deadlines for funnel and cancellation flow changes across states
Product launches are tightly coordinated with peak season (Thanksgiving Week 45) and holiday periods
Wallet initiative is foundational, progressing from minor work to full launch with voucher migration in Q1
Search functionality is critical with ongoing resource allocation until INP (Interaction to Next Paint) performance issue is resolved
Preset V2 release is data-driven, dependent on positive Net Revenue results with 4-week maturity period
Multiple parallel workstreams: strategic initiatives (70% capacity), design, product, and product analytics tracks
Notable product launches tracked: June 23 (product cards + Search), June 27 (Filet mignon surcharge), July 9 (Recipe details cards)
System performance monitoring is ongoing with fixes deployed throughout (OS on Dashboard, EOS/Cart post-checkout, widget optimizations)

results.purpose: Product development roadmap for Good Chop (meal delivery service) covering 2025-2026, tracking strategic initiatives, feature releases, team capacity, and key milestones across quarters
key_data_points: Strategic initiatives allocated 70% of dev capacity
Legal deadlines: July 14 (Funnel, Cancellation deflection), August 18 (all changes published)
Migration to Pricing service needed mid-October
Dev capacity ranges from 5-33 story points across sprints

entities.name: Good Chop
entities.context: Main company/product being developed

entities.name: Wallet
entities.context: Major Q1 initiative including funnel work, campaigns launch, voucher migration, and full launch

entities.name: Dashboard
entities.context: Separate new dashboard development (Milestone 1) in Q1-Q2, paused after Milestone 1 for CRO initiatives

entities.name: Seamless
entities.context: Development spanning Q1-Q2 with funnel integration, UAT phases, and DIY version in Q3

entities.name: Welcome Kit
entities.context: Q2 development with marketing campaigns launched June 6

entities.name: Search & Product Cards
entities.context: Redesign project in Q2, launched June 23

entities.name: One Time Purchase (OTP)
entities.context: MVP spike and development in Q3-Q4

entities.name: RAF (Refer-a-Friend)
entities.context: Q1-Q2 initiative with credit reward at $0

entities.name: PCS v2
entities.context: Rolled out July 23 to 20%, then July 31 to 100%

entities.name: Claudia
entities.context: Team member returning, partially OOO during OTP spike

entities.name: Pame
entities.context: OOO 3 weeks, returns with 6 devs

entities.name: Areeba
entities.context: Maternity leave until Q4 2026

entities.name: Bolo
entities.context: Paternity leave from October 17 for 3 months

entities.name: Khaled
entities.context: Confirmed UPM Reactivations handled by Payments team

entities.name: Wunderkind
entities.context: Fixed cookie sizes on July 24

entities.name: Genesys
entities.context: Widget live after HF CC widget removed July 16

insights: Heavy Q1 focus on Wallet infrastructure and migration work before major feature development
Strategic pivot: Dashboard development paused after Milestone 1 to prioritize CRO (Conversion Rate Optimization) initiatives
Significant team capacity fluctuations due to leaves (maternity, paternity, OOO) impacting Q3-Q4 delivery
Compliance and legal requirements are major constraints with multiple deadlines throughout the year
Product development follows a pattern: Spike → Development → UAT → Bug fixes → Launch
Mid-year (June-July) shows high release velocity with multiple launches: Welcome Kit (June 6), Product Cards/Search (June 23), compliance features (July)
Technical debt addressed through migrations: Voucher Migration, PCS v2, Pricing service, Cash Credits (W45)
Peak season preparation requires extended deadlines and resource allocation adjustments
Cross-functional coordination evident across Dev, Design, Product, and PA (Product Analytics) teams
Experimentation culture: RAF credit experiment, Best Value experiments, preset V2 dependent on net revenue results

key_data_points: Dev capacity ranges from 5-33 story points across sprints
Legal deadlines: July 14 (Funnel, Cancellation deflection), August 18 (all changes published)
Migration to Pricing service needed: mid-October

entities.context: Development with product card redesign, launched June 23

entities.name: RAF (Refer-a-Friend)
entities.context: Credit reward at $0, design and product work

insights: Roadmap follows agile methodology with 2-week sprints across 4 quarters
Strategic initiatives consume 70% of development capacity, leaving 30% for other work
Multiple team members taking extended leave (maternity, paternity) impacts capacity planning
Heavy focus on wallet and payment systems in Q1, shifting to CRO and user experience improvements in Q2-Q3
Legal compliance is a recurring theme with multiple deadlines for funnel and cancellation flow updates
Product launches are timed around peak shopping periods (Thanksgiving in Week 45)
Dashboard initiative was paused after Milestone 1 to prioritize conversion rate optimization
Multiple system migrations planned: Voucher, PCS v2, Pricing service, Cash Credits
Design and Product teams work in parallel with development, with handovers at key milestones
Significant technical debt being addressed: persisting free add-ons, two-week cadence improvements
Customer-facing features prioritized: Welcome Kit, Search improvements, Product Card redesign, Reactivation UX
Analytics and tracking are ongoing concerns (INP resolution, GA events for critical flows)
Several rollbacks and fixes noted in production (RAF credit, OS on Dashboard, CC widget issues)

results.purpose: Tracks AI-Native pilot and pre-pilot team onboarding progress, including team details, points of contact, and integration with project management tools
key_data_points: Onboarding dates range from September 2025 to December 2025
JIRA links mostly unavailable (marked as 'Can't find link')
Only 2 teams have DORA metrics links available

entities.name: Pepijn Senders
entities.context: Primary onboarder for 6 out of 7 teams

entities.name: Ebrahim Kargar
entities.context: Co-onboarder for 6 teams and PoC for MarTech Voucher Validation

entities.name: Vadim Shaygorodskiy
entities.context: Co-onboarder for MarTech Voucher Validation

entities.name: MarTech Voucher Validation
entities.context: First pre-pilot team onboarded (9/14/2025)

entities.name: Engagement DAU
entities.context: Pre-pilot team, PoC: Edu Morôni

entities.name: CCM Bulk Uploads
entities.context: Pre-pilot team, PoC: Vimal Garg

entities.name: Conversions
entities.context: Pilot team, PoC: Oleksii Svarychevski

entities.name: GoodChop
entities.context: Pilot team with complete DORA metrics, PoC: Alexander Matlin

entities.name: Squad Checkout
entities.context: Pilot team with complete DORA metrics, PoC: Kate Zimina & Vitaliy Shvarz

entities.name: Cross Selling and Subscription Flexibility
entities.context: Latest pilot team (12/10/2025), PoC: Arbaaz Dossani, Deo Nathaniel, Leo Lee

entities.name: HelloFresh
entities.context: Organization using Atlassian JIRA and Tableau for tracking

insights: Transition from pre-pilot to pilot phase occurs around mid-October 2025
Significant gaps in JIRA integration - most links are unavailable or can't be found
DORA metrics tracking is incomplete - only 2 out of 7 teams have working links
Pepijn Senders and Ebrahim Kargar are the primary onboarding team, handling nearly all implementations
Team onboarding accelerated in November with 2 teams onboarded within 4 days
Documentation and tooling integration appears to be a challenge across teams
Later pilot teams (GoodChop, Squad Checkout) have better metrics integration than earlier teams

insights: Roadmap follows agile methodology with 2-week sprints across 4 quarters
Team capacity significantly impacted by multiple leaves (maternity, paternity, OOO) in Q3-Q4
Major focus shift: Dashboard development paused after Milestone 1 to prioritize CRO (Conversion Rate Optimization) initiatives
Compliance and legal changes are critical constraints with multiple deadlines throughout the year
Product launches are clustered: Wallet (Q1), Seamless (Q2), Welcome Kit (Q2), Search/Product Cards (Q2-Q3), OTP (Q4)
Peak season preparation requires resource allocation adjustments and INP resolution tracking
Multiple system migrations planned: Voucher Migration, PCS v2, Pricing service, Cash Credits
Design and Product teams work 1-2 sprints ahead of development for handovers
Several rollbacks and fixes noted in production (e.g., 'No reason' rollback May 23, CC widget removal July 16)
Free add-ons feature has extended development cycle spanning multiple quarters with grace period ending April 15
Preset V2 release is data-dependent, requiring positive Net Revenue results before full rollout

results.purpose: Recipe management and menu planning workflow for HelloFresh Canada (HFCA) meal kit service, tracking weekly recipe configurations, labels, tags, and promotional campaigns
key_data_points: Product lines: Health Product Line (slots 1085-1094), Carb Smart, Cal Smart, Protein Plus
Active campaigns (2025): Winter Warmers (W46-47), The Office (W43-44), Fall Flavours (W39-46), Global Cuisine (W38-40)
Special tags: Veggie, Family Friendly, Spicy, Optional Spice, One Pot/Pan, Sheet Pan, Dinner Bowls
Regional variations: ON only MOD, AB & BC only surcharges
Timing: Menu upload at T-2, QA checks required before activation

entities.name: HFCA (HelloFresh Canada)
entities.context: Primary brand operating the meal kit service

entities.name: CCM (Content/Campaign Management system)
entities.context: Platform where menu weeks are uploaded and managed

entities.name: HC (likely HelloChef or Hello Content team)
entities.context: Team responsible for uploading menu weeks into CCM

entities.name: MP (Menu Planning)
entities.context: Team that identifies recipe classifications and communicates via Slack

entities.name: Naomi Harper
entities.context: Contact for Protein Plus label logic questions

entities.name: Cat & Nat
entities.context: Partnership running W36-39 in 2025

entities.name: CPS (Content Production System)
entities.context: System where missing recipe information must be updated

insights: Complex multi-step workflow requiring coordination between Menu Planning, Content teams, and QA processes
Heavy reliance on manual checks and overrides for specific recipe slots and promotional campaigns
Seasonal and promotional campaigns drive significant labeling requirements (Winter Warmers, Fall Flavours, Global Cuisine)
Regional pricing variations exist (ON-only, AB/BC surcharges) requiring slot-specific configuration
Quality assurance happens at multiple stages: pre-upload, post-upload, and post-activation on live site
Product line evolution visible: 'feel-good' label deprecated in W10+ 2025, replaced with tag-based logic
Static content strategy: 10 parent slots for Static Favourites, additional bestsellers added
Cross-functional dependencies: Slack coordination (#hfc_weekly_menuplanning), Product Calendar checks, CPS updates required
Data integrity emphasis: 'COPY AND PASTE VALUES' warning suggests formula dependencies need to be locked
Ongoing campaign management through 2025 with overlapping promotional periods requiring careful tag management

results.purpose: Consumer product tribe roadmap tracking initiatives, priorities, delivery timelines, and capacity planning across multiple squads (Engagement, Loyalty & Virality, Consumer Foundations)
key_data_points: Priority levels: High, Medium, Low with confidence ratings
Domain Objectives: 'Ignite Daily Engagement to Fuel Our New Growth Engine' and 'Evolve Loyalty to Reward A Long-Lasting Relationship & Engagement, Not Just Transactions'
Key metrics tracked: DAU/MAU ratio, weekly recipe engagement, cookbook visits, loyalty opt-in rates, reward redemption rates, AOR (Average Order Rate)
Capacity planning includes: BE, RN, Web, iOS, Android resource allocation

entities.name: E06 - Inspire Squad
entities.context: Engagement tribe squad focused on recipe discovery, cookbook features, and user education with 5 initiatives planned for Jan-Feb

entities.name: E09 - Missions Squad
entities.context: Loyalty & Virality tribe squad working on Loyalty Hub entry points and Loyalty 2.0 MVP Milestone 1 (Earn & Burn)

entities.name: E10 - Rewards Squad
entities.context: Loyalty & Virality tribe squad delivering Loyalty 2.0 MVP Milestone 2 with tiers and journey integration in March

entities.name: E05 - Client Platform Squad
entities.context: Consumer Foundations tribe squad handling Snowplow migration

entities.name: Discovery Hub
entities.context: New feature to solve 'inspiration paralysis' with curated content linking to Recipe Hub

entities.name: Recipe Import Wizard
entities.context: Feature being improved to reduce friction and provide better error messaging

entities.name: Cookbook
entities.context: Core feature being promoted to permanent bottom navigation position to increase accessibility

entities.name: Loyalty 2.0
entities.context: Two-milestone MVP rollout: Milestone 1 (Earn & Burn points/rewards) in Feb, Milestone 2 (Tiers & integration) in Mar

entities.name: HelloFresh app
entities.context: Primary platform for all initiatives with focus on increasing DAU/MAU ratio

entities.name: Shopping Experience
entities.context: Listed as dependency for Discovery Hub initiative

entities.name: Communications - High Touch/Iterable
entities.context: Dependency for Loyalty Hub entry points expansion

entities.name: Snowplow
entities.context: Analytics platform migration in progress

insights: Heavy focus on engagement and retention through recipe discovery and cookbook features in Q1 2025
Loyalty program undergoing major transformation from transactional to relationship-based model with two-phase MVP rollout
Information Architecture changes removing Loyalty from navigation bar requiring mitigation strategy for awareness
Recipe import and cookbook features prioritized to establish app as 'indispensable in-kitchen co-pilot'
Multiple initiatives targeting same KR of increasing DAU/MAU ratio, indicating coordinated engagement strategy
Confidence levels vary significantly: Recipe Import improvements rated High confidence, while in-kitchen execution utilities rated Low confidence
Cross-platform delivery required (BE, RN, Web, iOS, Android) for most initiatives
Localization platform rollout planned for Q4 2025 as foundational dependency
20% capacity ringfenced for maintaining base version of loyalty program during 2.0 transition
